moves.1. e4: Hi everyone!  Time for Round 2 against IM Beafyness.  Again another loss, if you want to see how it all unfolds then do read on .......
moves.6. Be3 e5 7. Nf3 Be7 8. Bc4 O-O 9. O-O: 9. 0-0 - I thought that my pieces were well placed here, I have a lead in development and I have just castled.  So where and oh where did it all go wrong?
moves.9... Nc6 10. Re1 Be6 11. Bb3 Rc8 12. Bxe: 12. Bxe6?? - I think in retrospect it may be here that things start to go a little pear shape.  It is very tempting to make this capture and I got suckered into it because it doubled up black's kingside pawns.  May have been OK had a pawn been on f3 and c3 but they ain't there here!  As a result black got a good centre.  Two question marks may seem harsh but I think it is a good idea to give this doubling up idea here the skull and crossbones!
moves.12... fxe6 13. a3: 13. a3 - classic move to stop a knight incursion on b4, but that horse later finds another lush paddock to graze upon!
moves.13... h6 14. h3 d5 15. exd5 exd5: 15. ...... exd5 - Voila, un position centrale tres tres forte avec des pions noir!  Chaque tour, Beafyness va mettre son pion a d4.  Le pion attacque mon Cavalier et Frere Lenoir!  Mais Frere Lenoir est allee a d2!
moves.16. Bd2 e4 17. Nh2: 17. Nh2 - In my earlier note just thought I would practice my rather rusty school French!  I will revert back to English to say that this is a typical jstevens1 game - welcome to the land of passivity.  Pieces pushed back and there they stay until black gets an attack out of nowhere!
moves.17... Qd7 18. Ne2: 18. Ne2 - to prepare an eventual outpost on d4 after a move like c3 - but I do not get the chance to play this.
moves.18... Bc5 19. c3 Ne5: 19.  ...... Ne5 - fearing a possible knight incursion on d3 I move my knight to c1.
moves.20. Nc1 Qf5 21. Rf1: 21. Rf1 - this move is necessary as black's dsb and the Wicked Witch of the West are attacking my f pawn.  But should Glenda (my queen) have gone to e2 instead?
moves.21... Nc4 22. Qc2: 22. Qc2 - Glenda defends both b pawn and Frere Lenoir, this is the black knight's new paddock and boy does he love it!
moves.22... Qe5 23. Ne2 e3 24. Be1 exf2+ 25. B: 27. Kh1 - after Henry has evaded the Wicked Witch and some wood has been exchanged I thought the attack was fizzling out.
moves.27... Ne4: 27. ...... Ne4 - Wrong!  Here comes a new Trojan Horse, threatening a nasty check on f2.  A pair of rooks is now exchanged with check.
moves.28. Rxf8+ Rxf8 29. Ng4 Qxe2 30. Qxe2 Ng3:
30. ........ Ng3 , ouch and double ouch.  Glenda was lured onto e2 (decoy) into the path of a royal knight fork.  I will be a whole piece down here against an International Master - far too much.  So I wave the white flag.  I try so hard not to be passive but somehow it just follows me around!

Joanne
